inn1.comm: ball 1 strike 1! Right on target is Doug Bollinger, gets some late movement inwards and the ball straightens, lands on a good length and thuds his pads in line with the off stump, Gayle was too lazy in getting his bat down on time and he played down the wrong line
sprays a full toss really wide outside off, the excitement gets to Bollinger
keeps it on a good length outside off and he shoulders arms
makes him play, swings it in to the right-hander and he pushes it to the on side
drifts close to the pads and he gently tucks it to the on side off the pads
full and swinging in with pace, he manages to dig it out back to the bowler
lands it on a good length outside off and he allows it to the keeper
tucks it to square leg and he thinks of a single but decides against it
149.2 kph, pace there, lands it on the spot outside off and well left by Dowlin
similar line and length, stays behind it and defends to the off side
sprays it on a full length outside off and he lets it go
bowls him the bouncer just wide down the leg side, too high to chase that
stays back and tucks it down to square leg
tucks him up for room outside off and he ends up getting a leading edge which rolls to third man
seemed much quicker than that, sprays it wide outside off though, Haddin was quick to collect that
quick one again, this one teases him outside the off stump, this is good stuff by Bollinger
he oversteps, he tucks it off his pads
Free Hit: He fails to put it away, it's a good ball, yorker outside off and he squeezes it to the off side
swings it in and bowls it on a full length, he pushes it to the on side
full on middle and leg and he pushes it to the on side
tucks it to short midwicket to get off the mark
lands it on a good length outside off and he shoulders arms
hurries him on with extra pace, the ball clips his pads and rolls away to the off side
stays behind the line and defends to the off side
fullish in length outside off, he gets to the pitch of the ball and pushes it wide of mid-off
good length on the off stump and defended back to the bowler
good length on the stumps and he defends it back, good line and length by McKay

error in judgement outside the off stump, McKay lands it just a touch wide outside the off stump and he gets forward and shapes to let it go to the keeper, but the ball brushes the face of the bat and Haddin and the rest know it
fires it outside the off stump and he lets it go
stays back and pushes it back to the bowler

tumbling like pins here, excellent delivery there, lands on a good length on middle and straightens a bit, Morton gets a touch forward but he's beaten for pace and gets hit on the pads in line with off and middle
fends it off and nearly spoons it back to the bowler
keeps it on a fullish length just outside off and he shoulders arms
bangs it short of a length on the off stump and hurries him onto the backfoot to defend
good length on middle and leg and the ball skids through and clips his body
shuffles and clips him behind square on the on side
stays behind the line and defends it back to the bowler
full on the off stump and he pushes it down the pitch down to mid-off
nice punchy drive off the backfoot, gives him width outside off and he rocks back quickly, rolls his wrists and finds the gap at the covers
stays back and defends down the pitch
fullish in length outside off and he lets it go to the keeper

Doug's on fire! He bowls it on a fullish length and angles it just across the right-hander, Simmons is forced to play at it and he shapes to drive straight, the late movement catches the outside edge and another easy take for Haddin
fires it with pace outside the off stump and he shoulders arms
pace like fire again, lovely angle outside the off stump, gets good bounce and carry too
angles it across the right-hander and he safely lets it go
comes over the wicket, lands it outside the off stump and he's happy to let it go
gets on the back foot and slices it down to backward point
keeps it on a good length on the off stump and he punches it down the pitch
holds the length back a bit and he tries to clip it to the on side, the ball rolls to the on side
bowls it on the half volley on the off stump and he makes good use of that freebie, pushes it through the line and beats mid-off comfortably
back of a length and he defends back to the bowler
thuds it short of a length outside off and he's beaten for pace, leaves it alone
rare freebie there from Bollinger, short and wide outside off, enough width for Ramdin to free his arms and cut it past the big gap between backward point and cover
he chases a delivery shaping away from him and misses it completely
more cautious outside the off stump this time as he lets it go, once again great carry to the keeper
tucks it to the on side and decides against the single
good leave and another good delivery, sails over the off stump
lands it outside off and he's happy to let it go
hurries him for pace and the ball clips his pads and rolls to the on side
outside off, gets forward to drive but then goes back and defends
gets behind the line and defends down the track
back of a length and he defends it back to the bowler
gets beside the line and steers him to the off side
gets all the way there but pulls back at the delivery stride, must have lost his run up somewhere
short and wide and slashed away high and down to third man who's square
full on the stumps and pushed just wide of mid-on, a bit more power needed on that shot
full outside the off stump and he leans forward to drive, he gets enough power on that to beat cpver, Hussey slides and tries to pull it back but the ball wins the race
hurries him on the back foot and he defends
stays back and gets a thick inside edge to his pads
tries to force it through the on side but mistimes it to mid-on
gives him width outside off and he tries to force it past backward point but he chops it to Ponting, he hits the stumps at the bowler's end but Deonarine's safe
good length on the off stump and he angles it down to third man
Free Hit McKay gifts him a fuller delivery on the off stump and he picks the gap at midwicket by shovelling it across the line
lands it outside off and he lets it go to the keeper
Johnson fires it quick but on the half vollety on the off stump, Ramdin gets his bat down and thuds it with force wide of mid-off, these two are settling in to a nice rhythm here
extra bounce and he fends it off close to his glove
tries to pinch the gap at cover but Clarke dives and stops it at extra cover
not much pace there, he has time to open the face and glide it down to third man
pushes it down to gully
stays back and defends back to the bowler
good running  there, tucks it just in front of mid-on and calls and sets off very quickly
shot of the morning surely, he picks the slower ball on the off stump, uses his wrists well and elegantly flicks it past the gap at midwicket, any subcontinental batsman would have been proud of that
oops, gets a thick inside edge which nearly hits his stumps, he suddenly wasn't sure where his off stump was
comes back in and he defends it back to the bowler
pulls but doesn't control it well, fetches it from outside the off stump, nobody there at midwicket though
comes round the wicket but sprays it full and wide, Ramdin gives the poor delivery the treatment by smashing it on the front foot wide of mid-off and cover
angles it on the pads and he clips it to the on side
short of a length outside off and he ducks under that bouncer
good delivery, beats him just wide of the off stump, he pokes his bat out
bangs it in short outside off and he reaches for it and smashes it over backward point, hops at the crease and puts it away
leaves it alone and it's drinks
outside the off stump. Ramdin comes forward and pats it back onto the pitch
on the leg stump. Ramdin comes forward and whips it away to deep midwicket for a single
good length outside the off stump.Deonarine comes forward and slaps it to deep point for a single
off the pads down the leg side to short fine-leg
now that's a rare misfield by Ponting! He concedes a single as Ramdin drives a length delivery on the middle stump to mid-on off the back foot
outside the off stump and loopy. Deonarine cuts but it just falls short of point
outside the off stump and coming in. Ramdin looks to drive it and is beaten
outside the off stump and width provided as Ramdin opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man for a single
good length delivery outside the off stump. Deonarine gets onto the back foot and stands tall on his tos as he pushes it to cover
outside the off stump. Deonarine pushes it to cover again

on the middle stump and hitting the leg stump or is it? Bowden certainly thinks so as Deonarine who was looking good has to go. There is an air of doubt around the dismissal as Bowden took his own sweet time in giving the decision and then walked over to the square leg umpire to discuss about it
short outside the off stump. Pollard gets it off the outside edge to third man for a single
on the middle stump. Pushes it to midwicket for a single
on the leg stump. Ramdin whips it to short fine-leg for a single
off the pad and glove to the first slip but Oxenford does not reckon that it hit the gloves
off the pads to short fine-leg for a leg-bye
on the middle stump. Ramdin pushes it back to the bowler, who deflects it back onto the stumpps
outside the off stump. Ramdin cuts it to point
tucks him up outside the off stump and he gets a leading edge to the off side
works it to the on side for a single
stays behind the line and defends to the off side
drifts on the pads and he clips it away down to fine leg
slower ball outside the off stump and he reaches out and carves it high over point
tucks it just wide of midwicket and calls for a quick single
stays back and taps it to the off side
tries to dab it down to third man but ends up chopping it wide of slip
fullish in length on the off stump and he works it wide of midwicket
stays back and hits against the turn down to sweeper cover
full in length outside off and he drives wide of mid-off

the bowling change works! Watson bowls it dead straight on the channel outside off, the ball holds its line and Ramdin fishes outside the off stump with  a half stride forward, thin edge and Haddin's good outing continues
back of a length outside off and he shoulders arms
similar line and length and he lets that go as well
gets on the back foot and taps it to the on side
gets beside the line and steers him down to point
confusion in the running, he taps it towards short cover and calls but sends his partner back, the throw to the bowler's end is wide
full on middle and off and he pushes it down to long-on
rocks back and cuts square of the wicket on the off side
he gives it a wham over the on side, there's a fielder in the deep to mop up
works it to square leg
gives him width outside off and he chops it down to the off side
full and driven down to short extra cover , risks the single and there's a direct hit at the bowler's end but Pollard is safe
lands it on the channel outside off and he lets it go
that's a jaffa outside off, he nearly edges it to the keeper
lands it on the channel outside off and he safely lets it go this time
stays right behind the line and  defends with soft hands
rocks back and wants to cut but he chops it down to the off side
stays back, waits for the turn and cuts to point
thrusts his pad forward and shoulders arms
good shot, he tosses it up outside off and Pollard moves quickly in position to slog him over midwicket
gets forward and defends
pushes it down to the off side
stays behind it and defends
stays beside the line and angles it wide of point
swivels and shapes to pull but he ends up gloving it to the on side
that's another jaffa outside off, just takes his bat away from the line as it passes him
lands it outside off and he safely lets it go to the keeper
pulls him but he mistimes it wide of midwicket
cut off the back foot towards deep point
swept towards deep square leg, this ball was a lot slower
pushed off the front foot on the off side
Smith leans forward and dabs the ball close on the offside for one
flicked off the pads through square leg
played carefully on the off side once again for a single, six ones in that over
full ball on off stump, driven off the front foot to mid-off
full ball on off stump once again, Pollard strides forward and thumps the ball past mid-on, immense power, he sent Smith ducking for cover at the non-striker's end
mid-on drops back to long-on, played towards midwicket this time
flicked off the pads through square leg, what's happened there? A bail has fallen on it's own. Probably the wind.
short of a length outside off stump, Smith tries to cut but gets a bottom edge into the ground to the wicketkeeper
short ball, a quick one too, Smith ducks into it
Pollard has changed his bat ...and pushes the ball to point off the back foot
driven off the front foot to long off
width offered outside off, Smith waits in his crease and cuts towards the fielder on the point boundary
punched back to the bowler off the back foot, Hauritz skips to his left and fields
cut, cut late and to the left of the man at short third man
tossed up on off and middle, Smith strides forward and blocks
short ball, a quick one, and Pollard hooks, or tries to. The top edge flies over Haddin and to the boundary
short of a length angling across the right-hander, Pollard plays it through square leg and thunders back for the second. Smith scampers, Pollard thunders.
full ball strikes Pollard on the pad, Bollinger appeals and then stops for he realises there's an inside edge
short of a length outside off, left alone by the batsman
good length slanting across Pollard who gets drawn forward and pushes the ball towards cover point

caught!! Bollinger's done it in his comeback over! The ball was on a good length and pretty straight, Pollard tried to hit across the line towards mid-on but the angle of the ball - across him - forced it to hit the leading edge, Johnson settled under the catch at mid-off
tossed up outside off, left alone by the batsman
straighter line and Miller works the ball off the front foot behind square for a single
Smith strides forward and blocks a straight ball
flighted delivery on off stump, Smith leans forward and drives to the fielder at cover
shorter in length and Smith goes back to cut, he can't beat point
he shapes up to play the late cut but decides to let the ball go in the end
short of a length delivery slanting across Miller, who drops his wrists and lets the ball go
full toss but Miller can't cash in, he drives straight to cover
edged towards third man for a single
left alone outside off, it's a front-foot no-ball so we have a free hit coming up
well what do I know? It's a full slow ball and Smith winds up and heaves, he hits it with the bottom of the bat down the ground
played towards mid off and a fumble allows the single
shot! A half-volley outside off stump and Miller crashes it through extra cover, lovely timing too
defended on the back foot, that pitched outside off and spun into the batsman
Smith moves back, makes room, and cuts from his stumps towards point
caught! Miller tries to drive, he's beaten by flight and dip and spoons a catch to White at cover point, West indies are in danger of leaving a serious number of overs unused
defended on the front foot, Hauritz appeals for lbw
defended on the front foot towards the bowler

he's hit it high in the air and the ball falls safe! Rampaul heaves at a flighted ball from wide outside off and lofts it against the spin into the gap at deep midwicket, this won't last very long if he continues batting like that
played off the back foot towards point, there's a deep point, third man and deep backward square leg in place
played off the back foot towards point again, identical ball, identical shot
length delivery on off stump, Smith swipes across the line and connects well, the ball races to the midwicket boundary
wider outside off stump from Bollinger, Smith lets it go
full ball just outside off, Smith plays a nice-looking straight drive but it's intercepted by Johnson at mid-off
played off the back foot towards point, Smith looks for the single but doesn't get it
flighted delivery from round the wicket into the left-hander, played back to the bowler
pushed back to the bowler once again
shot! Rampaul plays a classic cover drive, he got to the pitch and drove that all along the ground
this time he moves across, gets down on one knee and sweeps the ball firmly to deep backward square leg, Watson dives over the ball and concedes four
Rampaul swings and misses, he was aiming for deep square leg again

smashed! Hauritz drops a bit short and Rampaul gets down on one knee and smashes it into the gap between the fielders at deep midwicket and deep square leg, three fours in the over and Hauritz is done for the day
bowls a speedy ball across the right-hander, Smith plays and misses
short of a length on off stump, Smith plays with an angled bat behind point
short of a length on off stump, defended on the back foot
good length on off stump, Rampaul tries to hit inside out but gets beaten
there's no room to cut but Rampaul tries to, he plays it to point
short ball but it's been called wide by Bowden
good length outside off stump, Rampaul swings hard but without any sort of feet movement and gets beaten
the slower ball at 109 kmh, Smith charges, reaches out, and whacks it down the ground, Hussey sprints across from long on and makes the save
full toss and Smith chips it through midwicket
another slower ball on off stump, the length is full, Smith winds up, and unleashes a mighty heave, Hussey watches the ball sail several rows back over long-on
faster delivery in the blockhole, dug out on the off side
defended on the front foot towards the bowler
driven down the ground to long on once again, Smith keeps strike for the last Powerplay over
driven down the ground to long off for a single
Rampaul pushes to point and Ponting fumbles to let the ball past him
straighter line from Johnson, Rampaul dabs towards midwicket for one, White sprints in from the boundary to prevent the second
extremely straight from Johnson and good length too, Smith defends
Smith pulls but the ball is well outside off stump and it beats the bat
Smith plays the last ball of the batting Powerplay to midwicket, Ponting can spread his field again
good length outside off, Rampaul lofts inside out over cover and clears the infield
Smith backs away to make room and cuts the ball square and comes back for the second
good length angling into the right-hander, smith waits in his crease and dabs the ball behind square
short of a length and straight, Rampaul jumps back and defends
a bouncer this time, Rampaul tries the hook but doesn't connect
Rampaul tries to hit down the ground but once again doesn't connect
Smith aims for deep midwicket but doesn't get any elevation, he hits it on the bounce to the fielder in the ring
edged and wide of Haddin! Smith backs away to make room and swings, aiming for the extra cover boundary, he gets a thick edge that flies through where first slip would have been
Watson appeals for lbw and Bowden says no ...he's definitely said no this time, that was missing leg
short ball outside off stump, smith pulls and misses
length delivery outside off stump, Smith lofts inside out over extra cover, Bollinger chases from mid off
short ball, well directed too, Smith gets inside the line and then moves his body out of the way
did that carry back to McKay? I think it fell just short. Rampaul pushed forward at a length ball and hit it with the high part of the bat, Mckay stooped low to catch it but it bounced before him
defended back to the bowler

direct hit! And it's Ponting! Rampaul jumps back to play a short ball and it goes towards point, Rampaul's deep in his crease when he starts running so Ponting has plenty of time to line up the stumps at the bowler's end and throw, he hits the top of middle

terrific terrific catch! Hussey's pulled off the spectacular! Smith heaves the ball towards cow corner, Hussey sprints from long-on, he covers about 40 meters to his right at top speed before diving full length and taking the catch inches from the ground

inn2.comm: oversteps first ball, pitches wide of off stump, free hit time
shot man! Steps aside and drills a length ball back in the air, forcing Roach to evade its path, that was struck to forcefully
pitches up outside off, some shape, Watson shoulders arms
fuller ball slants into the pads, Watson clips to mid-on
shot! Leans into a nice pitched up one outside off and threads the gap between cover and point, uses the wrists real nice that time
on a length and Watson defends it back to Roach
pitched up and he meets it with a firm front-foot drive to cover
no use of having slips if you bowl outside leg, Marsh turns it away
down the pads again, Watson flicks and misses, Ramdin leaps
good shape back in from just outside off and Watson leaves
back of a length and he gets into position to defend
too straight and he gets a little brush on the pads, sets off, Morton runs in from square leg and has a shy but misses by some distance
on a length, just outside leg, and defended to midwicket
good ball, pitches leg and moves across and Marsh pushes to cover
short ball sits up and surprises Watson who jumps up and does well to keep the ball down in front of square leg
short again, he hops up and uses soft hands to defend to cover
full and he reaches out to drive, hits it with hard hands and the bat face turns, so he gets an inside edge to the leg side
super shot! Spots the short ball and pull that immensely over deep fine leg, wide of the fielder running around
gets across and steers this one down to third man for one
drives a full ball with too hard hands and gets another inside edge
angles across Marsh who gets his back leg across and drives to cover
leans in and drives this one to the man at cover
shorter ball outside leg and he clips that out to past the sweeper
better length, pitches leg and angles across, Marsh shoulders arms
good length again, this time he plays it to midwicket
on a length and he meets it with a full face of the bat
full and aiming at off stump, Watson jams it to backward point
pinches a single this time, meeting the ball and angling the bat
what a shot! Just a push off the front foot, nice high and straight bat, and Watson just has to hop aside to allow the ball go down the ground for four
another lovely straight drive, too straight in fact, and Roach in his followthrough gets a touch on it
gets back and steers this one backward of point for one
pitched up and Watson drives off the front foot to cover
back of a length, pitches leg and straightens, Marsh gets back and plays it down wide of gully
a bit too straight so Watson turns it toward midwicket and sets off
there's that straight drive again, just meets the ball with a push and it speeds past Roach and mid-on for four more
full on the pads and now he clips between mid-on and midwicket
hits a length and gets Marsh in two minds, he tries to leave it but its too close to him and clips the inner part of the bat and misses the stumps
back of a length and angling across and he defends to the off
back of a length and he gets back and defends
a bit wider and he steers it down to third man for one
good ball and good leave, pitches leg and shapes across nicely very close to off, Marsh judges it and lets it past
now he sucks Marsh into a feel outside off and beats the bat
close to the body off a shorter length and Marsh chops it fine
clips off the pads but cannot beat midwicket
on middle and leg and he pushes it to the off side
edged and dropped by Dowlin at slip! Angles across Marsh who reaches out and slashes and gets a thick outside edge but its in and out of Dowlin's hands as he leaps up and tries to take it
good length and Watson pushes it to cover
pitches it up, gets some shape back in, driven to point
good length again and now Watson defends watchfully
good shot, goes back and opens the face to guide a shorter ball down past slips to third man, runs hard and comes back for the second
back of a length, Marsh covers off and defends to point
too straight, he gets up and turns it to square leg
just spots the length and pulls off the front foot, connecting well with those strong forearms and gets a flat six over square leg, just evading a leaping fielder
straighter and fuller ball, turned uppishly toward mid-on, gets a leading edge in fact and runs hard to pick up a single off the mishit
just outside off and Marsh shoulders arms

chops it on! Marsh has been struggling against this angle across the stumps and has been caught between angling the bat and leaving, and he perishes trying to run one too close to the body, the ball takes the under-edge and hits the stumps
back of a length, Watson covers off and defends it back
fuller ball as he searches for shape, driven off the front foot to cover
loud, loud shout as one shapes back in and strikes Watson just outside the line, what seems to work for him is the fact he got a big stride forward, and though he misses with the bat he survives
much better shot, he tried this last ball and pulls it off now, meeting the ball with a long stride forward and driving past extra cover
back of a length, he gets over the bounce and dabs it past point
gets up on the toes and punches a short ball to point, sets off and gets off the mark first ball, taking on the fielders
pitched up outside off and he lets it go
fuller and straighter, he gets across and looks to clip but ends up pushing it back
nicely done, walks into the shot and threads the gap at cover
goes down the wrong line
on a length and he defends to cover
on the walk again, meeting the ball and driving to cover
nicely pitched up on middle and off and Watson keeps it out
good length again and no room to work with so Watson defends
picks the slightly shorter ball and clips it in the air over square
easy pickings, just leans into this ball and goes up and over the bowler for four, well wide of any catcher, that was just hit intentionally on the rise
short of a length, he gets back and across and defends
wrong length and he short-arm-jabs between midwicket and mid-on
too straight, he turns it out to deep midwicket
overpitched outside off, Watson slashes in the air to the left of a diving backward point fielder
another terrific shot from a man in form, almost premeditated, just heaves off the front foot across the line and the ball lands just short of the ropes at deep midwicket
gift-wrapped ball to get a fifty, a full toss, which Watson puts away past extra cover, another good effort from him and his summer of success continues
hits a length and he firmly pushes the ball to cover
short of a length on the stumps, Watson thinks about pulling but decides to push the ball back down the track instead
full toss, Ponting doesn't spot it and pushes it back to Roach
pulls back the length and lands it on the dime, it cuts back and Ponting stabs at it while losing a hand off the bat
fuller ball, comes forward and pats it back
comes forward on the walk and drives the ball to extra cover
too short, too fine, and Ponting hooks out to fine leg
leans into this one and drives with a thick outside edge behind point
tossed up and gets some drift, Watson is firm off the front foot
goes back and across and punches the ball down the ground
drifts down the pads and he gets a little tickle on it
comes well forward and defends to the off side
reaches out and drives to the off, where two fielders converge
some turn there, draws the edge and runs down to third man
pushed back to the bowler
thin little nick and Watson has to go! That pitches on just about the perfect length and forces Watson to push at it, and the wee bit of shape takes care of the rest
short ball to welcome Clarke, sails over and is called wide
gets up and over the bounce, tapping just wide of slip, looks up at Ponting who hurtles out for the single
gets up and across and works the ball to midwicket
short and wide, up goes Clarke to slice that wide of gully
back  of a length outside off and he shoulder arms
slides in, he works it off the hips to leg
spins in from middle, he goes back and defends
pushes it to point off the front foot
pulls out the lap-sweep and top edges safely
turn and bounce, drifts down leg and then rips after pitching, he pushes and is beaten, struck very high on the thigh
strides forward and pushes the ball to cover
gets back and across and pushes the ball away off the back foot
stands up tall and slashes a short ball behind point
onto the front foot, pushing this ball to the man at cover
strays down the pads and he hops and glances it fine
another short ball down the stumps, Clarke jumps up and tries to paddle-pull but ends up with a top edge over the keeper for four
beaten! Lovely ball on a length outside off, neither short not full and that does for Clarke, who hops back and pushes down the line, beaten for pace
goes back in anticipation and defends the short ball this time
tossed up and he drives it down the ground, Miller intercepts
wider ball, he angles the bat and steers it past slip
nicely tossed up and Clarke defends back to Miller
drift and turn, Clarke gets forward and pats it back
arm ball, he gets across and tucks it off the pads past square
drifts back in and he pats it back with a full face
gets up and across and punches the ball out to the sweeper at leg
short of a length, up goes Ponting to defend it back
gets forward and drives the ball past cover
comes forward and pushes the ball to cover
slides down and he gets a tickle on it past short fine leg
slides down the pads, he turns it away to the on side
comes forward and drives the ball into the off side
uses his feet and drives down the ground wide of mid-off
too straight, worked out to man in the deep
stands there and works the ball across the stumps to midwicket
fuller ball, met with a firm push but Pollard gets a hand on it
comes onto the front foot again and pushes it back
shorter ball angles in, he starts to press forward but then hops back and angles the bat to steer the ball to third man
gets forward and across and clips the full ball off the stumps
gets tall and slices the ball off the front foot into the covers
tossed up, Clarke comes out to negate the turn while walking across the sticks and turns the ball past midwicket
lovely use of the feet, just skips out and makes room and drives the ball over extra cover, inside-out, for half a dozen, thats the shot of the innings
now he jumps back to the sixth stump and puts the ball away past cover
slides down the pads and Ponting turns the ball to square leg
oh what a shot! Just goes back to a fractionally short ball and punches on the rise past cover, how did he pick the gap?
again speared down and he glances it past short fine leg
comes forward and pulls, not timed to perfection and square leg fields
again on the walk is Clarke, meeting the ball and turning it past midwicket
takes on the short ball with a lovely pirouette, pulling in front of square
walks across toward off again and brushes the ball to square leg
maximum! Excellent timing from Ponting, pulling off the front foot and getting it over deep backward square leg, he just picked the length and used the wrists
now he slashes at one pitched up outside off and edges to third man
tossed up, Ponting on-drives the ball to midwicket
again comes out and clips the ball away
better length and Clarke defends off the back foot
no turn, gets across and pushes to midwicket
tossed up, driven down the ground
marginally short and Ponting rocks back to pull over midwicket and up comes his half-century in good time
slides way down the leg side
onto the front foot and driving through to point
comes across and whips the ball out to deep midwicket
bit shorter, back goes Ponting to force it to the man at cover
on the pads, turned away straight to midwicket
uses his crease to counter the inswing with a flowing push to long-on
back of a length on off stump and Ponting turns it to midwicket
down the pads, Clarke shuffles and works it away for a single
leans into a drive but cannot beat the man at cover
another excellent pull shot, wrong line and that disappears past square
